Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Today is the test launch day for the inaugural Sabre store. Brr brr brr BRR [imitating trumpet] and I, Dwight Schrute, am in charge of the entire operation. If I can prove myself today and the store is a hit with the media and Nellie sees this, the vice presidency is mine.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Are you holding this chair?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: 'cause I feel like I'm gonna fall off.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes. Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm not wearing the right shoes for this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We went over this, ok? Your tiny fingers make the best knots.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey Strangers. So stoked for the Sabre store opening.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey, my name's Tabitha. I'm camped out in front of the Sabre store so I can be first in line for the new Pyramid. Psst. It's me Erin. Dwight had me pretend to be a hipster to create hype, and it's working. There's already people camped out behind me.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Test launch day, people. Now, I would like to fill you in on a little secret about me to inspire you today. Now, I know you probably all think I'm this patrician goddess. But here's the truth. I was born in the little working class town of Basildon, and until the age of 32, [cockney accent] I talked like this, which was bloody horrendous, innit? I came from dirt, no lower than ... what's lower than dirt?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Loam, magma, mantle, outer core, inner core.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yeah, thank you. Loam. Bloody loam, I came from. I hit rock bottom when I auditioned for the Spice Girls. I didn't even get a callback.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Which Spice Girl?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: The black one. I never stood a chance.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Now, think about my journey here today, and let it inspire your journey.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. Nellie, thank you. Thank you so much.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Yep

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Today is press day and press is gonna make or break this store. And for a tech company, press can only mean one thing - bloggers. Dossier on bloggers. Bloggers are gross. Bloggers are obese. Bloggers have halitosis. You're gonna love 'em. Ryan is going to be the main event today. He is the pitchman who is going to give the feisty yet profound speech worthy of a world's fair. Ryan, you ready to do this?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: When people see this presentation, they're gonna [bleep] in their pants.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Come on, man.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Seriously disgusting.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Cathy, you will be the hot girl who talks to bloggers.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Ugh. Kill me. That was my idea.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Packer, you will be the sexual predator who has come to prey on the trendy teenage girls who are obsessed with the Pyramid.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Uh... that is excellent.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: I don't see what that gets us, but I'm a team player.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Perfect casting, right?

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Schrute's out to get me. But I'm playing the long game. As soon as he messes up, I swoop in like a sexual predator.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I want to create a sense of wonder and enthusiasm as if, at the end of E.T., candy poured out of the screen. Do you understand? I wanna get goose pimples.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Speaking of pimples, let's release the BLOGGERS!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Morning, everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, Andy, guess what happened to me this morning?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Don't care. Tell me later.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Listen, it's important. You've gotta hear this.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What do you got?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, my god!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Do you have a black eye?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes, I do. Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I woke up at 4 am by accident in time for the paper to be delivered. Guess what?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It's not a kid on a bike. It's a man in a car.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Andy, who punched you?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, I was on the can. What's this about a black guy in the office?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Black eye, Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Will someone please explain what's going on here? Since the interesting thing happened til now, so much time has passed, it's like my life is buffering.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Here's what happened. Pam and I were arriving for the day. And there was a gang in the parking lot on bikes, on, on motorcycles. And they were just hassling Pam...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's true.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: They had, uh... weapons.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Weapons.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I just stepped in to talk some sense into them.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But these were not the kind of people who use their words.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Punches were going, and I ducked a few, landed a couple, and I was fighting them off. It was totally, like, like, senseless crime.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank goodness he was there.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Good job Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah [all murmuring]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I didn't do anything any of you wouldn't have done.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Open the gates! There's plenty for everyone. No need to panic. There's plenty for everyone!

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Quit it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There's plenty. Don't stampede. No need to stampede, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I was ahead of you!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, okay. Hey, hey. It's gonna be fine. It's gonna be fine. There's plenty of Pyramids.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Come on. I was in line before you.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: So you're a blogger right?

Quote.Speaker: Blogger
Quote.Text: Yeah. Blogger.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: God, stay away. Oh, I always get in trouble around bloggers. I'm trying to be a good girl for once.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Uh yeah. I already bought my Pyramid, but I don't want to leave yet. I haven't had so much fun since seeing... zoo-Ey Desh-channel at the Couch-arilla music festival. So fun.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: How can we feel safe knowing that there are gangs here? We should call the police right now!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no, we don't need to call the police. They'll just ask everybody questions, get up in everyone's business, right, Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Police are a hassle. We settled this on the street.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And my eye will heal. But if the police come, then we will forever stain our neighborhood as a troubled area.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Why would you care what the police think of our neighborhood?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Because I have neighborhood Pride. 1-8-5-0-5.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Guys, guys. That's so vague. You gotta do the zip plus four. 1-8-5-0-5 dash 7-4-2-7.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Look, I don't feel safe. I think we should call the police.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Exactly. We need to feel safe, which is why... Toby is giving us self defense training.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Me?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Right Toby? Will you teach us self defense?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, um... I can't believe you remembered. I do self-defense. Um, I'll go put on my cup.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Blogger
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I wasn't really sure which one of you is Chuck.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] Yeah, no, it seems to be going great. Andy got beat up by a fifth grade girl?

Quote.Speaker: Blogger
Quote.Text: Look at that guy. He's got his Sabre phone on, and he's not even using it.

Quote.Speaker: Blogger 2
Quote.Text: This is a perfect photo for my Daily Fail blog.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, I - I gotta go. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Dwight, what is a fail? That sounds bad.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no, no. It's good. It's really -- on the Internet, it's a really -- that's a really good, good, thing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you trying to sabotage this entire event?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm very sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: We gave you an Arrowhead for free for the day. How hard would it have been to do this, hmmm? "Hello. Hi sweetie. It's Jim. I'm calling you from the new Arrowhead, which is why my voice is crystal clear. And my hand will never get tired because of the ergonomic shape."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm really sorry. Is there anything I can do, maybe pretend to be Chuck?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You could have pretended to be Chuck. I begged you to pretend to be Chuck, but you chose to be yourself, and you can no longer be Chuck! Surrender the tripack. You know what you have to do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Point it towards the store, idiot!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughs] You know what I mean? One of these buttons is -- damn it. Take over.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh hey, Hey, hey, you guys, you must be lost. Listen. Excuse me, sir. Yeah, the fountain where you can feed the pigeons is out behind the bank. Tell your great-grandson to bring his kid by. Okay. So long. Here we go. Erin! Psst! Come on! The elderly suck the life out of the young. Get them out of here!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: We are closed! Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Self-defense is not some fun boxing match, okay? This is about escaping with your life. So... strike, scream, and run. All right? Let's try it.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [smacks Meredith's head] [screams] [runs out]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Ow.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: That may have been my fault.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What the hell, Toby?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay, look, in a real crisis situation, you're not gonna have to time to think, okay? So just remember, I-A-A-T-G. "It's all about the groin."

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What if you're being attacked by a ... smallish man who happens to not have a groin?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I don't think that's very common.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What if you're being attacked by a 4'11" man who is penisless?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why are you fixated on this hypothetical transgendered attacker?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why don't we start with the basics? Show us how to defend ourselves against a baby, and then like, a fifth grade girl, and then, you know, if we have time, on up to a scary man.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, the most common scenario is a larger man attacking a smaller female.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So in that scenario, what if the victim sucker-punches the attacker in the face? What can the attacker then do to better protect himself?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's interesting that you're drawn to the point of view of the attacker. You would like the turn of the table. Okay, the latest Chad Flenderman novel... [everyone groans] written from the point of view of his nemesis, Dr. Lucifer Wu.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Can I please leave? I have a rape flute.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: All right, well, let's try one simple technique together. Okay, why doesn't everyone stand? Okay, so... you're being attacked. You've got your hands up. Simple palm strike to the chin. Up to the chin. One, two.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: One, two.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [softly] Take that, kid.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Cathy, I would like to introduce you to Fatty Gruesome. He is a freelancer for Wired magazine.

Quote.Speaker: Lady Blogger
Quote.Text: Patty Grossman. I'm a woman.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But you still work for Wired, right?

Quote.Speaker: Patty
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good! Okay. Flirt away.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Sabre. It's time to come home.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yeah, I mean, I think ...it seemed like you were a little nervous.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, no [bleep], Sherlock! Can somebody please tell me something encouraging about this presentation before I go out there in front of a million people and do it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. I know, I know, champ. Calm down, just listen.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You know what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You just need to realize that so much rides on this. You have no idea.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm trying to make him feel important.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: God. I wish Kelly were here. She always knew what to say.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Um... [imitating Kelly] Oh, Ryan, you're so smart. You're smarter than Mark Zuckerberg and those Google guys all combined. Hee hee hee.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You're so ignorant. You barely know what you're talking about. That is so ridiculous. You really need to read a couple books.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's a book? [giggles]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: On my God. You're so embarrassing. My mom would say the best stuff, though.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [ahem] You can... [slightly effeminate] You can do it Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: And you know that I'm capable of this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're the only one who can do it, s-sweetie.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What did you think of the presentation?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I thought it was great, sweetie. I would just fix that one --

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh! "Fix" means you hate it! I knew it! I need something to drink!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, get him a water.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, not a water. A sports drink. I hate everything in that fridge. Not red! Get me something yellow or green from a nearby store. Not red!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why are you just standing there? Go to a nearby store and get him a yellow or green sports drink!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Now, if your attacker is willing to defile a corpse, you better stop playing dead right away and just make it known that you're alive.

Quote.Speaker: Lady
Quote.Text: Forgive me for interrupting. I believe my daughter had an altercation with somebody here, some fancy gentleman with a squeaky voice?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [deep voice] I think you guys might have the wrong Office.

Quote.Speaker: Girl
Quote.Text: That's him... the guy I hit.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You've gotta be kidding me.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Poor Andy! First you got beat up by a gang, and now she kicks your ass?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, Kevin -- [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Lady
Quote.Text: What about the lady you hit with the pine cone?

Quote.Speaker: Girl
Quote.Text: There. That chubby one.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I just had a baby.

Quote.Speaker: Girl
Quote.Text: Yesterday?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Lady
Quote.Text: Apologize.

Quote.Speaker: Girl
Quote.Text: Sorry I kicked your ass in front of your "thin" girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How 'bout we wait til next year after you have your kid?

Quote.Speaker: Lady
Quote.Text: You know what? Tiffy's going to college.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [deep voice] Listen, I don't know what you guys are talking about, but I guess I'll just accept your apology so we can get on with our day.

Quote.Speaker: Lady
Quote.Text: God bless. Friend of mine uses your paper. You do good work. Bye bye.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So, Toby, I think we should do a different self-defense seminar -- "How to protect ourselves against tiny little girls."

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: There's no shame in getting beaten up by a girl. My ex-wife used to demolish me.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: No, there is shame in it, okay? We have to draw the line somewhere.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh my God, I think I see the imprint of a ring pop.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh... [Kelly laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Have you seen Erin?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm on break.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh God... Hey no! Where do you think you're going? You've gotta stay for the big presentation we've got this young wiz kid -- Ryan. He's like an even more handsome Bill Gates.

Quote.Speaker: Blogger
Quote.Text: When's the presentation?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's moments away. Just stay here!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hey Uncle Lucas, it's your nephew Ryan. Honestly, I could use a prescription for ritalin right now. Well, I know you did one for Aunt Carol. Oh, so it's different because it's your wife? Well, that doesn't make any sense to me.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: How you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Don't talk to me right now. I'm sorry. I- I know you're my boss, but seriously, you need to get the hell out of my face. What I don't understand is... [voice fades]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [to Dwight] Your little man is unraveling. Now go and fix it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Sorry about kicking you out. It's just, we don't want our brand associated with death.

Quote.Speaker: Old Lady
Quote.Text: It's okay. I'll go to the Costco and search for handsome men.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You're not married yet?

Quote.Speaker: Old Lady
Quote.Text: [laughs] Oh, I was. My husband was my best friend. He passed away.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: My best friend was my boss, Andy. We dated for a while, but since then, he rejected me, and we're not really friends.

Quote.Speaker: Old Lady
Quote.Text: Someone rejected you? With that body and those bazongas? Forget him!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah! Forget him! And you should forget your husband.

Quote.Speaker: Old Lady
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How long has he been in the bathroom?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: About ten minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jeez! What's he doing in there? [cell phone vibrates]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oops, that's my phone. Am I allowed to answer it or are you gonna freak out?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are there any bloggers around?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's Ryan. "I'm sorry. I lied. I'm not in the bathroom. I can't do it. I need to see my mom. I'm going home."

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: What is the delay here? Where's Ryan? Why is he not here?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I had to send him home. As brilliant and creative as he is, he is nothing... compared to this guy!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's right. Will you just give us a second?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: You are gonna bloody ruin it. You're gonna bloody ruin it because you're a no-good half-assed cock-eyed...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: okay.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: That's....

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim --

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm not doing the Presentation.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look at me. Look at me! Look... at... this... face. This is not the face of a performer. This is the face of a scary apparition you see before you die. I'm telling you... if you don't do this, [whispers] I don't stand a chance. Please, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, I'll do it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. O... Kay! Go get into Ryan's costume and check out his notes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: A costume?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Of course there's a costume! [laughs] Oh, this is gonna be great. There's nothing like some last-minutes changes to really energize a presentation.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did you pass out in there? What is taking so long?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I've been in here for 20 seconds.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hurry up. Let me in. I wanna watch you get dressed. Did you find the eyeliner?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm not wearing eyeliner.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You are wearing eyeliner, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Coldplay's Clocks]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Time. Space. Gender. [Dwight mouthing words] There are no rules anymore. All boundaries are breaking down in the wake of the infinite future. The only thing that -- the only thing that remain -- the only thing that remains are the things that have stood the test of time -- love, values, and of course, the pyramids -- the strongest shape ever constructed, a shape that fits all other shapes inside of it. [softly] No, that's --

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's true.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This... is the future, because... This is the past. I've been through a lot of issues in my life. I've seen drug addiction -- unemployment. I've been in a relationship that tore my heart apart, without ever being able to accept that love drove the pain. [scattered applause]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: When I was ten years old, my parents took me to Disney world. I cried the whole time. I was not able to comprehend the beauty that was before me. I just wanted... to go home. This is what the Pyramid will do for you. It is the bridge to the world. It has a usb port. Wireless... will be available in 2013. You can play Anything from Chuck to Cars 2. With the Pyramid, you have the connection to everything -- in time... and space.

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: ahhhhhh

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Psst.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [image on Pyramid] Sabre... It's time... to come home.

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: [applause]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right. Thank you so much. Wow. Wow! And good night! [applause continues]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Thank you. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay, this isn't over. Let's stay focused, okay? We made fun of Andy earlier for getting beat up by a little girl, but... little things can be dangerous.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Whether it's a gremlin or chucky the doll. The key is to throw it in something. Like a fireplace, or a tub of electricity.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay. Good point...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Good point? What is a tub of electricity?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I don't... I don't...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: With all due respect we know what we're defending against: a twelve year old female bully.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I was a twelve year old bully.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Great! I think Kelly should attack Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Others
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, that's not a bad idea, actually, because I have had a lot of pent up aggression.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Good. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I don't know if this is gonna help...Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Let's go Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: We should stay to maybe some more traditional models...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You think you're so pretty! Well you're not gonna be so pretty come Prom time!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay, this is what's called pre-violent posturing.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Take that! Not so pre-violent anymore!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm at what's called "the decision point."

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey. Kelly Kelly, Kelly... come on.... Ow! God! My good eye!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs] Oh boy. Oh no, I'm not laughing at you. I'm laughing at, um, something that Cece did on the playground earlier -- yesterday. This morning.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know why I got hit by girls? Because I stood up for others. Pam and for Toby. I stepped in and I didn't care that I was standing up to girls. You may wanna ask yourselves, "Where were you when the girls came?"

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Tough day. Yes. But I feel good. I put the office in their place, took a bunch of pain killers, drank a half a bottle of wine, took my pants off. I just feel good!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, okay, I will be the first to admit it. We could have integrated more Chuck into the Presentation.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Dwight. You're the vice president.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ha, ha, ha, ha! Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [squealing]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay! Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: aagh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hah! Yah! [kicking and punching the air] Boom!
